channel.title: Need help with insidiax client for mac
channel.description:
Hey guys, So ive been trying to run insidiax (unleashed?) on my mac. To get the server to work, i just recompiled it on a pc using jdk like 1.6 and then it works fine on a mac. for the client, i recompiled it on the mac (works fine) but when I run it, it says:
"InsidiaX is loading.. java.io.FileNotFoundException: nullMaps/mapConfig.txt (No such file or directory) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:106) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:66) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(FileReader.java:41) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:111) at client.startUp(client.java:9047) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:6073) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680) java.lang.NullPointerException at java.io.File.<init>(File.java:222) at Update.<init>(Update.java:25) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4766) at client.startUp(client.java:9057) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:6073) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680) "
Also, where do I put the cache on a mac?
Any help would be appreciated. Thank you.

item.title: Need help with insidiax client for mac
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ashish215, post:3, topic:431958”]So if I change the directory, it will fix all the problems listed above?

Also, how do I change the directory on a mac? (since there is no c drive)(i just want it to be put in my default folder instead)

Thanks again.[/quote]

Change it to System.getProperty(“user.home”);

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with insidiax client for mac

item.description:
@ashish215 wrote:

Also, how do I change the directory on a mac? (since there is no c drive)(i just want it to be put in my default folder instead)

item.title: Need help with insidiax client for mac
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

You’re going to have to do two things.

  1. Determine an appropriate place to put the cache (really depends on you, and where you want it stored).
  2. Change the findcachedir() method in signlink.java to return the directory you put the cache in.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with insidiax client for mac

item.title: Need help with insidiax client for mac
item.dc:creator: @ashish215 ashish215
item.description:
@ashish215 wrote:

Hey guys,
So ive been trying to run insidiax (unleashed?) on my mac. To get the server to work, i just recompiled it on a pc using jdk like 1.6 and then it works fine on a mac. for the client, i recompiled it on the mac (works fine) but when I run it, it says:

"InsidiaX is loading…
java.io.FileNotFoundException: nullMaps/mapConfig.txt (No such file or directory)
at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
at java.io.FileInputStream.(FileInputStream.java:106)
at java.io.FileInputStream.(FileInputStream.java:66)
at java.io.FileReader.(FileReader.java:41)
at client.setNewMaps(client.java:111)
at client.startUp(client.java:9047)
at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33)

at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)
"

Also, where do I put the cache on a mac?

Any help would be appreciated.
Thank you.
